entry.title: Re: Business rule trace for external onboarding users
entry.content:
@HarshaShet 

1.Create Rule Trace object with existing admin user

2.Export this Rule Trace from Import Export Data Tool. Select Include Dependencies and Select all data records as No. For Select objects dropdown select your Rule Trace object and click on Export

3.To get the exported Rule Trace -go to Scheduled Job Monitor look for MDF Data Export job type. Click on View Details and click on Download Status.

4.It would download a Zip file which has file with name Rule Trace.csv. Open Rule Trace.csv in Notepad++ or any other app but do not open in excel as it causes alignment issue leading to import failure.

Now in csv file replace admin user ID by new hire User ID save the file and update ZIP file.

Import:

1.Go to Import and Export Data, select Import Data select ZIP File tab and upload the updated ZIP file. Click on Import.

2.Go to Scheduled Job Monitor look for MDF Data Import job type. Click on View Details and see that Progress says that Passed : 1 and Failed : 0

3.Now Go to Manage Data and load your Rule Trace object and you can see that now the Login User is changed to new hire.

4.Now we have to external user visibility of this Rule Trace object. For this we need to add on Save rule to set External User Visibility to Yes. Before that we should enable the visibility of External User Visibility field on Rule Trace Object Definition to Read Only.

Go to Configure Object Definition > Select Object Definition > Select Rule Trace > Take Action > Edit .

mdfSystemExternalUserVisibility field > Click on Details > Select Visibility as Read Only. Save the Objects Definition

5.Now create On Save Rule as below and add it to the object definition and save again

 

if condition: always true

set ruletrace.extuservisibility equal to yes

 

Result :By this we would be able to access Rule Trace for logging.

entry.title: Re: Text Object cannot move to X=0 or Y=0 with Snap to Gr...
entry.content:
Hi Groovy,

Great post, nice to see info with details and test results...

As you know CR 2016 is end of life a year ago, so no chance to get it fixed, end of life info:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354088411.html?locale=en-US

I tested this in CR 2025 at 110% and I see the same thing, even using Size and Position did have problems:

It would move the Y but not the X, after viewing.

CR's formatting engine is very complex, it uses third party (Microsoft dependencies) and others:

USP10.dll

GDI.dll and GDIPlus.dll

Default printer properties, I tried setting No Printer (USP10) and my Lexmark laser printer (GDI), it did not make any difference.

I also tried setting it to .160 cm and 100% and it too does have issues, if you want to call it that...

I suspect this has always been this way so not likely anything R&D can do about it, it's all part of the complex formatting logic CR uses to place objects.

I'll let R&D know to have a look at this post but I don't expect there is much they can do to resolve the issue. It's basically a minor issue and too costly to look into.

Also note, with Microsoft updates, I am using Window 11 25H2, there have been a few formatting issues R&D is still working on and too complex to fix at this time.

Curious, are you reporting the issue because it's affecting your use or just noting the issue you discovered?

Bottom line is you know the limitations, so make a note when designing reports not to use those Zoom levels.

Don

entry.title: Object Dependency in Material Classification
entry.content:
Introduction

Object dependency refers as set of rules that are considered when classifying objects. The purpose of object dependency is to optimize and automate the classification process, that is, the characteristic value assignment. We can use object dependency to forbid specific value combinations, require a characteristic or set values for characteristics based on other selections.

Below table shows the differences between local and global object dependencies.

Global Object DependencyLocal Object Dependency
  • Available across the entire system, so they can be used by multiple objects or processes. 
  • Can be reused in different contexts wherever the same conditions or procedures are needed.
  • Promotes consistency and reduces redundancy when you have conditions or procedures that are common and applicable to multiple objects or scenarios.
  • Specific to a particular object or process and are not available for use where in the system.
  • Not designed for reuse outside the scope of the specific object or process they are tied to.
  • Use when the conditions or procedures are unique to a specific object or scenario allows for more concise and context-specific definitions without affecting other parts of the system.

In this blog, we will look at two types of object dependencies, which are Precondition and Selection condition. We will use material classification as our example. 

Below table shows the characteristics of bolt variants.

Pre-requisition:

  1. Create characteristics in Tcode CT04 or Manage Characteristics app.
  2. Create Class type 001, BOLT in Tcode CL01 or Create Classes app.
  3. Assign the characteristics created in step (1) to the Class type 001.
  4. Create SAP material codes for the bolt variants, M6 â€“ M16.
  5. Assign the class to the materials in Tcode CL24N or Manage Class Assignments app.

Precondition

Precondition object dependency type is used to temporarily forbid the value assignment of characteristics or use of characteristic values. 

Example 1,

Requirement: Coating Plain is only available for Tensile Strength <=400 MPa.

What to forbid: Value of CHARC COATING.

Where to assign Object Dependency: Value of CHARC COATING, Plain.

Syntax: TENSILE_STRENGTH<=400 Mpa.

1. Go to Tcode CT04 or Manage Characteristics app.

2. Go to Values tab and select the value Plain.

3. Go to Extras -> Object Dependencies -> Editor at the header.

  • Select Processing Mode as Classic.
  • Select Precondition radio button.

4. Key in the syntax or use Input Help (F4) button to build the syntax.

5. Select check button to check for any syntax error.

6. Save the error free syntax and the characteristic.

Thus, when assigning object to class in Tcode CL24N or Manage Class Assignments app, we can see that the coating Plain is not available when Tensile Strength > 400 Mpa.

However, coating Plain is available when Tensile Strength = 400 MPa.

There will be inconsistency if CHARC value Plain is used when Tensile Strength >400 Mpa and the screen canâ€™t be saved.

Selection Condition

Selection condition object dependency type is used to make characteristics dynamic as required characteristics.

Example 2,

Requirement: CHARC MATERIAL_TYPE is a required characteristic when CHARC MATERIAL is valuated as Carbon Steel.

What becomes a required characteristic: CHARC MATERIAL_TYPE

Where to assign Object Dependency: CHARC MATERIAL_TYPE.

Syntax: MATERIAL = â€˜Carbon Steel'

1. Go to Tcode CT04 or Manage Characteristics app.

2. Entry is not required for CHARC MATERIAL_TYPE.

3. Go to Extras -> Object Dependencies -> Editor at the header in change mode.

  • Select Processing Mode as Classic.
  • Select Selection condition radio button.

4. Key in the syntax or use Input Help (F4) button to build the syntax.

5. Select check button to check for any syntax error.

6. Save the error free syntax and the characteristic.

Thus, when assigning object to class in Tcode CL24N or Manage Class Assignments app, we can see that system hits error if try to save without valuating CHARC MATERIAL_TYPE when CHARC MATERIAL is valuated as Carbon Steel.

However, the screen still can be saved but classification status will be changed to 3, Incomplete.

In conclusion, we can see object dependency is a powerful tool which can be used to automate the classification process.

entry.title: Expiring Price Handling Powered by Joule
entry.content:
The Joule capability "Expiring Price Handling" has been released in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502.3. This blog introduces this feature in detail, so that you can interact with Joule smoothly and manage expiring prices efficiently. 

 

Overview

You can ask Joule to fetch prices (stored as condition records for pricing in sales in the system) that will expire soon. For expiring prices, Joule can help renew them by extending their validity periods and adjusting the condition amounts or ratios according to your requirements. After you confirm to extend the expiring prices, a price renewal background job will be created. You can also check the progress and result of the price renewal job via Joule.

Figure 1

Please check out the following help document and demo for a glimpse.

    • Help Document: Renew Expiring Prices
    • Demo: Renew Product Prices with Joule

 

Feature in Details

 

Definition of "Expiring Price"

Before using this feature, it's important to understand what qualifies as an "Expiring Price". Joule retrieves prices that expire between the current date and the given date (including both dates) without a successor record. Only records without a successor are considered "Expiring".

  • Case 1 and 2: Prices without a successor --> considered "expiring". 
  • Case 3: Even if its Valid-To date falls between the current date and the given date, it has a successor with a continuous validity period starting right after its Valid-To date --> not considered "expiring".
  • Case 4: Already expired prices --> not considered "expiring".

Figure 2

Note that, this feature only retrieves/renews the prices approaching expiration (meaning still valid for the time being), but cannot fetch/renew the prices which are already expired (Case 4 above).

 

How Are Expiring Prices Renewed?

Instead of updating the original Valid-To date of the expiring price, Joule creates a new continuous validity period for the expiring price (with Valid-From date set to the date one day after the Valid-To date of the expiring price). Optionally, the new validity period could have a new condition amount/ratio. The purpose of this is to keep the existing "Expiring Price" unchanged, but create its successor only.

Do take note that, the new validity being created could possibly overlap with the existing validity that lies in future, such as the Case 2 above. Assume that the gap between the expiring price and its future validity is 9 months long. If we extend the validity period of the expiring price by 1 year, the new validity and existing future validity will overlap for 3 months. In this case, the new validity will overwrite the existing validity during the overlapped period.

 

Always Start from "Show Expiring Prices"

You can activate the "Expiring Price Handling" feature by talking to Joule with phrases like below:

  • "Show me prices for sales organization 1710 that expire before December 31, 2025."
  • "List the prices with condition type PPR0 that are expiring before Dec 31, 2025."
  • "Are there any prices for condition type PPR0 and sales organization 1010 expiring before December 31, 2025?"

Even if you ask Joule to extend the expiring price directly, you will be redirected to show expiring prices, because the extension/renewal could only be performed on the expiring prices already listed in Joule.

Figure 3

Expiration date is a mandatory for querying expiring prices. If the date is not given, Joule will prompt you to provide one, so that it can proceed to search for the expiring prices.

Figure 4

For best results, include at least one of the following filters in your query. Currently, these are the only fields supported as the filter.

  • Condition type
  • Sales organization
  • Distribution channel
  • Product
  • Customer
  • Customer project ID
 
Expiration Urgency Level

The expiring prices will be listed and sorted by urgency:

  • Red:  â‰¤30 days left before expiration
  • Orange:  31~60 days left before expiration
  • Green:  >60 days left before expiration

Figure 5

 

Dynamic Grouping

At the time this blog is being written, Joule can display up to 30 prices per message. If more than 30 expiring prices are found, they will be grouped dynamically,  for example:

  • By condition type + sales org. + urgency level.
  • By condition type + urgency level.
  • By urgency level only.

This ensures the total number of groups is kept â‰¤30.

Figure 6

 

Check Price Renewal Job Log

After clicking "Confirm" to extend prices, a mass creation job will be created in the background to create the new validity periods. You can check progress and result of the renewal job by clicking the "Check Progress" button. The job result is summarized in a card format. You can click "Open in App" to navigate to the "Manage Prices - Sales" app to check the details of the job.

Figure 7

Alternatively, you can also go to "Manage Prices - Sales" app --> click "Monitor Imports and Jobs" at the upper-right corner. --> switch to "Scheduled Jobs" tab. All the previously created jobs are listed, including the mass creation job created from "Manage Prices - Sales" app. Note that the price renewal jobs created via Joule are always named "Price Renewal xxxxxxxxxxxxxx".

Figure 8

 

Limitations

Instability of Resolving Expiration Date

If you ask Joule to show the prices expiring in N months/days, Joule may occasionally resolve the expiration date incorrectly. This can lead to an inaccurate or empty results. This is because the current LLMs do not inherently have awareness of real-time information.

Thus, we recommend providing specific dates to Joule, such as "Show me prices that are going to expire before 31 Dec, 2025" or "List prices due to expire on 31/03/2026".

 

Short Request Timeout

There's a short request timeout (only 15 seconds) imposed by Joule on any API call to backend. If you don't provide any filter criteria, you may encounter a timeout.

Figure 9

Therefore, always include at least one of the supported filters while asking Joule to show the expiring prices.

entry.title: 2H 2025 Release Highlights of SAP Best Practices for SAP SuccessFactors Time Management
entry.content:
Dear All,

Hope you are doing fine.

We are excited to share news about the Best Practices package for Time Management 2H 2025 via the upgrade center. We have some new features (new country localizations for Time Tracking) along with enhancements for existing countries.

Disclaimer: Please note these features are currently available only on preview. The final version will be updated on RTC or production date for 2H 2025.

 

But before starting, let us share how you can find our Best Practices packages. In the Upgrade Center, filter for SAP Best Practices, and observe that the packages are listed under Recommended Upgrades:

 

Germany Time Off Enhancements

Changes to Maternity Leave

We updated maternity leave and sick leave in 2H 2025, to cater labor law changes, based on the feedback received from our professional service consultant colleagues.

The existing picklist TypeOfBirth_DEU has been enhanced with new values, to reflect miscarriage:

Existing validation rules have been updated, and new rules have been added:

  • business rule which ensures that the fields Type of Birth and Calculated Date of Birth are filled when posting a maternity leave
  • business rule for determining the start of the maternity protection and the expected return date based on the calculated date of birth and the selected type of birth
  • business rule for determining the end of the maternity protection period and the actual return date based on the real date of birth
  • business rule which is triggered when the actual birth occurs before the originally entered calculated date of birth. The business rule adjusts the start date, the expected return date, and the actual return date based on the real date of birth
  • business rule for issuing a warning message when start and end date of the maternity leave request are changed manually
  • business rule that ensures that the type of birth â€œPrematureâ€ is used correctly based on the real date of birth.

Letâ€™s have a brief example: upon selecting Maternity time type, a message telling which fields must be filled is issued:

After entering Type of Birth and Calculated Date of Birth:

the maternity leave period is automatically defaulted:

Changes to Continued Pay for Sickness

Earlier, the end date of continued pay in case of sickness was determined using a business rule.

Now, the end date of continued pay in case of sickness is calculated automatically based on a configured absence pay scheme, which is assigned to an absence pay policy. The absence pay scheme and policy are also part of pre-delivered content. Here are the screenshots of the absence pay scheme and policy:

 

Rework of Holiday calendar and Holiday category

We deliver holiday calendars for each State of Germany, till 2040 inclusive. Each holiday calendar comes with the holidays relevant for that State, together with the holiday class and holiday category.

 

For more details on all these enhancements, please have a look at our workbook available on the SAP help portal; you can also download it from the upgrade center to review the content.
And donâ€™t hesitate to use the updated Germany Time Off Best Practices package from upgrade center to view the content directly in your instance. You could use the below upgrade to apply these changes and benefit from a quick accelerated implementation:

 

Saudi Arabia Time Off Enhancements

We updated the existing configuration for Time Off Saudi Arabia to cater to Saudi Arabiaâ€™s Labor Law changes. For more details on the Labor law changes, refer to the SAP Blog Saudi Arabia 2024 Labor Law Updates: Whatâ€™s New for Time Management in EC.

Changes to Maternity Leave

According to the new Saudi Labor law, a female employee is entitled to 12 weeks (84 days) of maternity leave, to be taken under specific conditions:

  1. Pre-Delivery Period: The employee can request maternity leave before the delivery date. The maternity leave must start between 28 days and 42 days before the calculated date of birth.
  2. Post-Delivery Period: The remaining portion of maternity leave must be taken after the delivery date.

To fulfill these requirements, a mandatory custom field Calculated Date Of Birth has been added to the Time Off Requests object definition, having as condition value the Maternity Leave time type:

The already existing take tule SFCC_TO_TakeRule_SAU_MaternityLeave, assigned to maternity leave time type, has been updated.
Letâ€™s consider the example of a calculated date of birth of November 16th, 2025. In case the start date of requested maternity leave is less than 28 days before or more than 42 days before the calculated date of birth, appropriate error messages are issued:
  

Also, when the start date is between 28 and 42 days before the calculated date of birth, but the entire maternity leave period is less than 84 days, an error message is issued:

In case all requirements as per the take rule are fulfilled, the request can be submitted:

Changes to Compassionate Leave

According to the new Saudi Labor law, Compassionate Leave entitlements must be granted based on the employee's relationship to the relative.

  1. 5 Days of Compassionate Leave are granted if the relative is Spouse, Father, Mother, Son or Daughter.
  2. 3 Days of Compassionate Leave are granted if the relative is Brother or Sister.

To fulfill these requirements, a mandatory custom field Relationship Type has been added to the Time Off Requests object definition, having as condition value the Compassionate Leave time type. A new picklist SAU_RelationshipType has been defined and assigned to this custom field:
 
A take rule SFCC_TO_TakeRule_SAU_CompassionateLeave has been defined and assigned to compassionate leave time type Compassionate Leave.
When requesting compassionate leave, Relationship Type displays as mandatory field in the time off request:

In case of relationship type Sister, 3 days of compassionate leave are allowed.
Thus, when selecting Sister in the time off request and requesting 3 days, the request can be submitted:

In case more than 3 days are requested, an error message displays and the request canâ€™t be submitted:

According to the new Saudi Labor law, the probation period for regular employees will be extended if any holidays or sick leave occur during this time. For details, refer to the SAP Blog Saudi Arabia 2024 Labor Law Updates: Whatâ€™s New for Time Management in EC.

For more details on all these enhancements for time off Saudi Arabia, please have a look at our workbook available on the SAP help portal; you can also download it from the upgrade center to review the content.
And donâ€™t hesitate to check the updated Saudi Arabia Time Off Best Practices package by deploying the content using Upgrade Center (follow the same approach as for Germany listed above).

 

Singapore Time Off Enhancements

We updated childcare leave, sick leave, and hospitalization leave in 2H 2025, to cater labor law changes, based on the feedback received from our professional service consultant colleagues. 

Changes to (Extended) Childcare Leave

The childcare leave quota is based on the nationality of the youngest child.

  • In case the youngest child is below 7 years old and is a Singapore citizen, the parent (employee) is entitled to 6 days of childcare leave per year. To be entitled to this type of leave, the employee must have completed 3 months of service at the company. Between 3 and 10 months of service, the entitlement is pro-rated. To be entitled to the full 6 days, the employee must have completed 11 months or more of service at the company.
  • In case the youngest child is below 7 years old and is a non-Singapore citizen, a fixed number of 2 days of childcare leave is posted. To be entitled to the full 2 days, the employee must have completed 3 months of service at the company.
  • If an employee, who has a child with SGP citizenship, leaves the company, and has completed at least 3 months of service at the company before leaving, the childcare leave will be pro-rated based on the completed months of service in the year of termination.

To reflect the childcare leave quota to which the employee is eligible, custom objects Childcare Lookup SGP National, SGP Childcare Lookup Termination, and Childcare Lookup Non-SGP National have been defined.
For SGP Childcare Leave time account type, the accrual rule SFCC_TO_ACC_SGP_ChildcareLeave has been updated, and a termination rule SFCC_TO_ACC_SGP_ChildcareLeave_Term has been defined and assigned to the time account type. An Absence Validation rule is assigned to the Childcare Leave time type to ensure that the employee cannot request more leave than they are entitled to based on the number of service months completed at the company.
For SGP Extended Childcare Leave time account type, the accrual rule SFCC_TO_ACC_SGP_ExtChildcareLeave has been updated to reflect the statutory regulation based on age and citizenship of youngest dependent.
Coming now to an example, letâ€™s consider an employee, who has a child below 7 years old, of Singapore nationality, and has completed 6 months of service at the company. This employee is eligible to 3 days of childcare leave:

The validation rule ensures that the employee cannot request more than 3 days of childcare leave:
  

Changes to Sick Leave and Hospitalization Leave

To be entitled to sick leave and hospitalization leave, the employee must have completed 3 months of service at the company. Between 3 and 6 months of service, the entitlement is pro-rated. If the employee has completed 6 months or more of service at the company, they are entitled to the full number of days as detailed in the Labor Law.
By using the updated SAP Best Practices solution for Singapore Time Off, you can now choose between time profiles with annual accrual of sick leave and hospitalization leave quota, or with monthly accrual of sick leave and hospitalization leave quota.
In case of an annual accrual, the existing time account types SGP Sick Leave and SGP Hospitalisation Leave, as well as the accrual rules SFCC_TO_ACC_SGP_SickLeave and SFCC_TO_ACC_SGP_HospLeave remain unchanged. Absence Validation rules have been defined and assigned to the Sick Leave and Hospitalisation Leave time types to ensure that the employee cannot request more leave than they are entitled to based on the number of service months completed at the company.
For example, an employee who has completed 6 months of service at the company, is eligible to 14 days of sick leave. An appropriate message is issued upon requesting 14 days of sick leave:

In case of a monthly accrual, new time account types SGP Sick Leave Monthly and SGP Hospitalisation Leave Monthly have been defined, to which the newly defined accrual rules SFCC_TO_ACC_SGP_SickLeave_MTH and SFCC_TO_ACC_SGP_HospLeave_MTH, respectively, have been assigned. For posting the monthly accrual amount, the Cap Accrual function is used. See below an excerpt of the accrual rule for monthly sick leave:

Letâ€™s consider an employee hired on February 1st, 2025. The sick leave balance of the employee looks in June 2025 as follows:
  
Finally, new time types Sick Leave (SGP_SICK_MON) and Hospitalisation Leave (SGP_HOSP_MON) have been introduced.

 

For more details on all these enhancements for time off Singapore, please have a look at our workbook available on the SAP help portal; you can also download it from the upgrade center to review the content.
And donâ€™t hesitate to use the updated Singapore Time Off Best Practices package by deploying the content using Upgrade Center (follow the same approach as for Germany listed above).

 

Time Tracking enhancements

Time Statements

Before going into details about the 2H 2025 highlights for time tracking, we owe you the news about the 1H 2025 highlight in this area, namely the delivery of time statements. The Time Statement feature allows employees to generate forms that summarize their work hours, absences, and time-related data.
We deliver sample time statements templates for both duration-based and clock time set ups. These statements contain details of the employeeâ€™s recorded times, absences, and time valuation results, such as overtime hours and premiums, for a selected time period. In addition, some organizational details of the employee as well as an overview of their time account balances are also displayed on the statement.
You could use the below upgrade to apply these changes and benefit from a quick accelerated implementation:

Time Tracking Singapore

Coming to the 2H 2025 release, we have introduced Time Tracking Sample solution for Singapore.

Flex Time Based Recording for Singapore

For Singapore as part of a country-specific feature, we deliver standard clock time-based recording along with dynamic breaks for flex time employees.  Flex time along with dynamic breaks allows your employees to come/leave work in a more flexible manner rather than a fixed working model with fixed scheduled breaks. The tracking of the hours worked can be done against a working time account (to ensure an employee meets his/her contractual hours or regulations).
This feature comes with:

  • Flex time bandwidth definition in work schedule for Singapore which starts from 06:00 AM to 07:00 PM
  • Dynamic Breaks which generate automatic breaks after 6 hours / 9 hours of worked time.
  • Times outside flex bandwidth or range are cut out and are categorized as unpaid times.
  • Alerts are sent to time administrators that times outside a bandwidth exists So that they can confirm the times performed outside a bandwidth as normal hours worked or as overtime/ fed to working time accounts. This is called â€œAllowed Flex Violationâ€.
  • Automated periodical processing of flex time / working time accounts to cut off or cap for example a balance of more than 40 hours before the new month starts. This is to meet contractual regulations or laws.

For more details, please have a look at our workbook available on the SAP help portal; you can also download it from the upgrade center to review the content.
You could avail this configuration using the Singapore specific time tracking package in Upgrade Center:

Temporary Work Schedule within Employee Self-Service UI

Weâ€™ve added permissions for the employee to maintain a temporary change of their working schedule, as well as a temporary change of public holiday calendar.

Employee Self Service for temporary change of work schedule

Temporary changes to an employee's work schedule do not modify the job information work schedule. Instead, they overwrite the schedule for a selected period for internal calculation purposes, such as time tracking and time valuation. This ensures that both the original and temporary schedule data remain available for more advanced processing needs.
The starting point for this functionality is the My Calendar application. This UI displays an employeeâ€™s planned working time in a calendar format. In the example shown, the employee follows a duration-based schedule, but clock time-based schedules are fully supported as well.
Within the My Calendar UI, a dropdown menu in the top-right corner allows employees to request a temporary change of work schedule (i.e., planned working time).

In the subsequent screen, the employee can choose the period that they want to change. After choosing the period the work schedule information derived from the job info work schedule is pre-loaded. The employee can then edit either the duration or change a day from a working day to a non-working day: 

Employee Self Service for temporary change of public holiday calendar

In addition to requesting temporary changes to planned working time, employees also have the option to request a temporary change to their assigned public holiday calendar. This is particularly useful in scenarios such as:

  • business trips to regions with a different public holiday schedule
  • temporary remote work from another location with different public holidays

Employees can request to overwrite the public holiday information assigned to them in Job Information, without modifying the Job Info data itself.

In the subsequent screen the employee can choose the period that they want to change, after which they search for the relevant public holiday calendar. After selection, a nice preview of the upcoming public holidays in the selected period is displayed:

For more details, you can check the following blog, too: https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-sap/new-2h-2024-sap-successfactors-time-tracking-features/ba-p/13796224

You could avail the updated Time Tracking Best Practices package by deploying the content using Upgrade Center:

These best practices add a lot of value in terms of accelerating your implementations and we hope to see more adoption from you (partners) in coming days.


Thank you for your attention.
Best regards,
Monica and Mohan

entry.title: Handling Unit (HU) Data in Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) - Buffer vs. Database
entry.content:
Working with Handling Units in EWM often involves understanding how the HU data is created, updated and handled by the EWM application. This post is to share my insights about the technical aspects of the HU data access.

In EWM, data that is currently being changed or created is typically kept in (transient) buffers: global tables defined in the function group /SCWM/HUMAIN as is the case with HU-buffer or object instances in the BO layer e.g. for the EWM deliveries. So, until the data is saved to the database, the â€œtransientâ€ data may differ from the persistent data on the database. This needs to be considered when data is being read and it also affects the APIs (functions/methods) which are used to access the data.

In EWM, there are functions/methods that only read from the database. Others may only read from the transient buffers and others may read from both. Using a wrong method/function may result in the use of wrong (obsolete) data.

Important technical aspects for reading & updating the HU information in EWM:

  1. Make sure the changes to HU are updated and that the HU buffer is filled and up-to-date e.g. by using methods like /SCWM/IF_PACK_BAS~SAVE, /SCWM/CL_HU_PACKING->SAVE.
  2. Access the HU data from the database or from the HU buffer?
    • Read HUs from Buffer only: FM: /SCWM/HUMAIN_DATA_GET, /SCWM/HUHEADER_READ
    • Read HUs from Database only: FM: /SCWM/HU_SELECT
    • Combined Read 1. from Buffer then from DB: API: /SCWM/IF_API_HANDLING_UNIT implemented with class:  /SCWM/CL_API_HANDLING_UNIT e.g. method: READ_BY_HUIDENT which uses FM: /SCWM/HU_READ_MULT or FM: /SCWM/HU_SELECT_GEN (additionally with BAdI: /SCWM/EX_HU_SELECT)
    • Combined Read 1. From DB then from Buffer â€“ no standard SAP API known to me, custom wrapper might be built if needed.
  3. Update the HU buffer specifically for a single HU e.g. via FM: /SCWM/HUHDR_INT_UPDATE
  4. HU buffer Restore - if necessary, e.g. if there is incomplete data restore the HU buffer e.g. by using FM: HU_PACKING_REFRESH. This ensures that all necessary HU-related buffers are correctly populated.
  5. HU buffer Cleanup â€“ e.g. to be sure HUs are NOT read from buffer: via class-method: /SCWM/CL_TM=>CLEANUP, /SCWM/CL_WM_PACKING ->INIT (HU buffer refresh controlled via interface parameter), FM: /SCWM/HUMAIN_REFRESH Warning: Do not use the cleanup methods in BAdI implementations in any way, because then the buffers (global tables) of the standard processing will be reset and not available for other processes. But in the transactional processing it is important to use it. EWM transactions may behave strange if you omit to cleanup after a COMMIT WORK AND WAIT.

For all of the above mentioned methods/functions - if you are following the clean-code approach please check additionally the released APIs listed in Note: 3578329 or via the Cloudification Repository Viewer.

Example: get HU information for deleted HUs in case of the Automatic Deletion of Empty HUs (EWM customizing flag set on packaging material type: /SCWM/V_TPMTYPWM â€“ HUDEL). In case this flag is set and the HU gets deleted right after it gets empty then in the further processing (e.g. for warehouse task confirmation BAdI) the HU data for the deleted HU is no longer accessible via DB read, it can be read only via the HU buffer.

To summarize:
In EWM the access to the necessary HU database tables is optimized, and the results are buffered. The standard data should be accessed via (standard) APIs which often imply reading from the HU buffer first, so using the APIs to get the HU Information, the general assumption is that the Handling Unit information has already been updated in the buffer. If working with custom HU data the correct update and refresh of the buffer should also be considered.

I hope this overview is useful. Any comments / corrections / Your views on this topic are much appreciated.

entry.title: Re: In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, how can we restrict TECO...
entry.content:
Good day @Deepankar1 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

App Extensibility: Find Maintenance Orders, Maintenance Order Data

Maintenance Order Component Data, Business Add-Ins for Maintenance Orders

Integrating the Service with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Integrating with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Configure Outbound Communication

In summary, there is no standard configuration setting in public cloud to directly restrict TECO when goods issue is not yet posted for a maintenance order. However, this control can be implemented cleanly by using the BAdI BADI_EAM_ORDER_BEFORE_SAVE in the custom logic app. The desired logic should:

  • Check all order components through CDS view I_MaintenanceOrderComponent
  • Verify that each has a completed good issue status,
  • Raise an error message if any component is still pending, preventing TECO.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Survey: ABAP Naming Conventions
entry.content:
kilian_kilger, 

This is a very interesting topic and something I am currently working on. I have implemented a Fiori App that works as a naming convention generator. The user enters the mandatory fields or nice to have fields, and in the end, they get a result showing what the naming convention for a specific object will look like.

In the currently designed app, on the JavaScript backend, I have to use a lot of hardcoded static values, which I am not very proud of. It would be nicer to have a rules table or an app for that. Otherwise, it would be  lot of manual labour every time the hardcoded values need to be changed/added.

Some time ago, I created an improvement request to SAP: Precheck Naming Convention for ABAP/FIORI Development artifacts during creation. It is basically an idea where SAP could implement a BADI, allowing customers to write their own rules for creating technical objects. Only if the rules are followed, could developers create a technical object. Unfortunately, it still awaits in the queue despite receiving enough community support. If you could do something to push from you end to push it, would be nicer ðŸ™‚

Philip Davy .

entry.title: Re: BAPI to retrieve Pricing Procedure details T683S`
entry.content: There is no standard BAPI that directly retrieves pricing procedure details from table T683S. Instead, SAP recommends using function modules or APIs designed for pricing configuration access, such as RV_CONDITION_TABLE_READ or PRICING-related modules. This is also taking into consideration, since T683S is a configuration table for pricing procedures, direct SELECTs are discouraged in favor of encapsulated access.

entry.title: Re: Query Regarding Automatic Quantity Change in Asset Cards
entry.content:
Hi,

My answer was only valid for the product version UPA (by using FIori App MFA to create and change assets), therefore it is valid for S4H Public Cloud in general. For legacy tcodes like ASxx, the situation is different. In case you observe something unexpectedly, please create an incident for your product version. Please note that automatic quantity update on asset master is only executed during posting if the UOM matches. If asset has kg but you post in g, no update is performed

Best regards, MICK.

entry.title: Re: SAP AVC OBJECT DEPENDENCY
entry.content:
Hello Ankit,

The syntax error occurs because the editor syntax in AVC differs from that of other programming languages, such as ABAP. You can refer to this link for our documentation on procedure syntax (it works the same way in Public and Private Cloud/On Premise). 

As in the example in the documentation, the 'THEN' part of the IF statement goes first (but without the keyword THEN), and the IF part follows (without an ENDIF):

$SELF.ALTO_TEST = ($PARENT.ALTO - 0.30) * 2 IF $PARENT.COLOR_COMPONENTES = 'GRIS'.

Please check if this resolves the issue, or if you still encounter a syntax error.

Best Regards,

Florian

entry.title: Re: How to find out which CDS Views are used in a Fiori A...
entry.content:
Good day @Orhan_Salman 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

To summarise, in public cloud you cannot view CDS view definitions directly in the backend but SAP provides official tools to trace them whilst adhering to the clean core approach in public cloud. You can use the App Support tool in the Fiori app to find its OData service. Look up that service in the Fiori Lab or SAP API Business Hub. These list the CDS views and entities used. Optionally, check Custom Fields and Logic for released CDS views in that business area. For example, Manage Sales Orders uses th OData service API_SALES_ORDER_SRV. This is built on the CDS view I_SalesOrder and its consumption view C_SalesOrderWthFldSel.

Below is a detailed option you can consider:

Open the Manage Sales Order app

Click the User Menu --> More --> App Support.

In the App Support pop-up, go to App information Ã  Technical Information. You will see all available details. This provides an SAP-official trace from Fiori app.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This November
entry.content:
In the age of AI, the skills we build today will define how we work tomorrow. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™ve launched a monthly series of blogs that spotlight the latest AI learning assets and upcoming learning opportunities.

Building on my previous blog where I introduced you to our newest AI live sessions Beyond Hype (which is all about getting productive with SAP Business AI), let me follow up with you on your most asked questions:

  1. What is Embedded AI?
    This is where SAP embeds AI features directly into its cloud solutions across the Business Suite, such as SAP SuccessFactors or SAP Customer Experience. In other words, these AI capabilities operate natively inside core business applications such as ERP, procurement, HR, and supply chain management. SAP customers benefit from AI immediately with out-of-the-box AI features which minimizes the need to build custom solutions from scratch. 

    Do you know about the Embedded AI Explained page that not only provides examples of embedded AI capabilities in enterprise solutions but also includes other helpful information? No? Check it out! My favorite embedded AI feature is SAP SuccessFactors Performance and Goals performance goal creation and development goal creation: Thanks to AI these features reduce the time needed to ideate and draft goal content while also making goals more concise. This slide deck showcases other ways in which SAP Business AI capabilities create value for every aspect of your business through key personas.

  2. Is there a place to get a complete overview of available AI features and Joule agents?
    Of course there is! Do you know you can explore AI offerings in the AI Catalog? It currently shows 313 AI Agents and Features, spanning from Beta, Early Adopter Care, and generally available. Just click on a feature to see further resources, roadmap info, and pricing details.


  3. Is there a step-by-step activation guide to set up Joule?
    Weâ€™ve got you! SAP Content Discovery provides a library of missions to get started with SAP Business AI. Missions include best practices and step-by-step guidance for use case implementation, supported by mission experts and the SAP Community. Start the Discovery Center Mission to establish a unified Joule instance and explore setup guides that include Joule in . Once you have Joule up and running, watch this video to see scenarios where Joule can significantly enhance employee productivity and check out the prompt cheat sheets in the Get Started with Joule deck.

     

    You also asked what the difference is between Joule and SAP Joule for Consultants. While both offer and share the same conversational user experience, they do actually address different needs and user groups. With Joule, business users can use natural language requests to receive conversational help when navigating their SAP systems, automating business transactions, getting insights grounded in their business data, and also when accelerating complex multi-step workflows with AI agents. SAP Joule for Consultants is more aligned with assisting system integrators and internal consultants who are delivering SAP projects and cloud transformations. With SAP Joule for Consultants, consultants get the expert-level guidance they need on-demand to help them make better decisions and execute project tasks according to best practices.

Want to dive deeper into the content? Rewatch the sessions and access the session material via SAP Learning Hub (subscription required):

  • Embedded AI in Action: Top Use Cases You Can Activate Today (recording)
  • From Activation to Application: Getting Started with SAP Joule for Consultants (recording)

Speaking of SAP Joule for Consultants: Have you heard about the SAP Mission to enable SAP Joule for Consultants? As you can see, the setup process is straightforward and the prerequisites for using it include a BTP Global Account, Cloud Identity Services, Access to EU10 or EU11, SAP AI Units (8019164).

Once youâ€™ve enabled SAP Joule for Consultants, youâ€™ll want to find out how to get started. For this, take a look at the video to tour the product and discover best practices. If you want to understand the business value and explore key capabilities and differentiators, complete the Learning Journey â€œAccelerating SAP Project Delivery Using SAP Joule for Consultantsâ€.

 

Hi Joule, where should I get started with the latest learning resources? *

Apart from live enablement sessions, explore our latest on-demand learning resources:

  • If you missed Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd, make sure to watch the recordings. Highlights include:
    • Manage and Optimize Prompts in SAP AI Core: Concepts and application (recording)
    • Demystifying the MCP, A2A, and ACP Protocols to Build Custom Multi-Agent Systems (recording)
    • Boost Your Developer Satisfaction with SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities (recording)

* Powered by the machine learning technology of SAP AI Business Services, personalized recommendations are generated to employees, in one place on the Learning home page, based on employee data.

As we look ahead into November, weâ€™re excited to share with you a new lineup of learning opportunities designed to help you expand your knowledge and make AI an advantage in your role:

  • November, 11, 3 pm CET: Build Your Own AI Solution with Generative AI hub. Understand the exact steps to build, extend, and run custom AI solutions.
  • November, 13, 4 pm CET: All Things Business AI: Latest Insights, Updates & Live Demos. Learn how to apply AI to streamline processes, boost performance, and unlock new value across your enterprise.

Stay tuned for more, and happy learning! ðŸš€

Joule #Joule agents AI Foundation Joule Studio #SAP Joule for Consultants SAP Business AI #AI Enablement #AI Skills

entry.title: SAP Fiori: Adding Field Validation Based on Other Field Values Using Controller Extensions OData V2
entry.content:
In many project use cases, we often encounter situations where the validity of one field depends on the value of another. For example, when a flag is updated or a key date is modified, the user must provide additional comments before saving the record.


In this blog post, Iâ€™ll walk you through how I implemented such conditional validations in a Fiori Elements Object Page using Controller Extensions.

Scenario

I had a requirement where:

  1. If the Last Working Date (LWD) was changed, then the Additional Comments (ARD Comments) field must not be empty.

  2. If certain flags or dropdown values were set to specific conditions (like â€œYâ€ or a specific code), corresponding comment fields were required before allowing the user to save.

Instead of modifying the generated metadata or annotations, I handled these validations using the Controller Extensionâ€™s beforeSaveExtension hook, which is triggered before the save action.

Implementation

1. Adding controller extension :- Add the controller extension file in app/webapp/ext/controller as  ObjectPageExt.controller.js

2. Add the controller file in manifest.json

"sap.ui5": {
    "flexEnabled": true,
    // other fields
    "resources": {
      "css": []
    },
    "routing": {
      "config": {},
      "routes": [],
      "targets": {}
    },
    "extends": {
      "extensions": {
        "sap.ui.controllerExtensions": {
          "sap.suite.ui.generic.template.ObjectPage.view.Details": {
            "controllerName": "app.ext.controller.ObjectPageExt"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  },

3. ObjectPageExt.controller.js

sap.ui.define(["sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension", "sap/m/MessageBox"], function (ControllerExtension, MessageBox) {
    "use strict";

    return ControllerExtension.extend("offboardingdashboard.ext.controller.ObjectPageExt", {
        override: {
            beforeSaveExtension: function () {
                const oContext = this.getView().getBindingContext();
                if (!oContext) return Promise.resolve();

                const oModel = oContext.getModel();
                const sPath = oContext.getPath();
                const oNewData = oContext.getObject(); // Current draft data

                // --- Step 1: Get the original (active) entity data ---
                const oOriginalData = oModel.getOriginalProperty
                    ? oModel.getOriginalProperty(sPath)
                    : null;

                // --- Step 2: Detect change in Last Working Date ---
                let bLwdChanged = false;
                if (oOriginalData && oOriginalData.cust_lastworkingdate && oNewData.cust_lastworkingdate) {
                    const dNew = new Date(oNewData.cust_lastworkingdate);
                    const dOld = new Date(oOriginalData.cust_lastworkingdate);
                    bLwdChanged = dNew.getTime() !== dOld.getTime();
                } else if (oOriginalData && oOriginalData.cust_lastworkingdate !== oNewData.cust_lastworkingdate) {
                    bLwdChanged = true;
                }

                // --- Step 3: Apply validation rules ---
                const aMessages = [];

                if (oNewData.cust_rehire === "Y" && (!oNewData.cust_rehirecomments || oNewData.cust_rehirecomments.trim() === "")) {
                    aMessages.push("â€¢ Rehire comments are required when rehire flag is set to 'Yes'.");
                }

                if (bLwdChanged && (!oNewData.cust_ardcomments || oNewData.cust_ardcomments.trim() === "")) {
                    aMessages.push("â€¢ ARD comments are required when Last Working Date has been changed.");
                }

                // --- Step 4: Show error message and prevent save ---
                return new Promise(function (fnResolve, fnReject) {
                    if (aMessages.length > 0) {
                        const sMessage = "Please address the following issues before saving:\n\n" + aMessages.join("\n");
                        MessageBox.error(sMessage, {
                            actions: [MessageBox.Action.OK],
                            onClose: fnReject
                        });
                    } else {
                        fnResolve();
                    }
                });
            }
        }
    });
});

How It Works

  1. The beforeSaveExtension method is triggered automatically before the Save action on the Object Page.

  2. We first read the current draft data and the original active entity.

  3. We compare fields like cust_lastworkingdate to detect changes.

  4. Based on certain conditions (like flag = â€˜Yâ€™ ), we push validation messages into an array.

  5. If there are validation errors, a MessageBox appears with all issues listed, and the save action is prevented.

UI Screenshots

     

When both the conditions are met :
-> last working day is changed and rehire flag is set to 'Y'

-> only last working day is changed

-> only rehire flag is set to 'Y'

 

Key Takeaways

  • Always perform value-dependent validations in the beforeSaveExtension hook for extensibility.

  • Use getOriginalProperty to safely compare values between draft and active entities.

  • Consolidate all validation messages for a better user experience rather than showing multiple alerts.

entry.title: Agentic coding of an SAP mobile app with Windsurf
entry.content:
In this blog post, I am going to create a similar mobile app as Iâ€™ve previously created in SAP Build Code. However, this time I will be using the Windsurf AI-powered IDE, combined with our recently released MCP server for mobile development kit.

It is important to note that while Windsurf is featured in this example, SAP is evaluating several coding agents to ensure broad compatibility with our MCP servers. This demonstration does not imply preference or endorsement of any product or vendor.

In my previous blog post, Iâ€™ve showcased the creation of a simple list-detail app with Cursor. Some would consider this scenario a bit too simple as the user of the app can only view information, and there is no authentication involved.

For this post, weâ€™ll focus on the mobile app creation and reuse an existing CAP-based data service, which combines a basic Product entity with a Supplier entity exposed from a demo instance of S/4HANA Public Cloud edition. In this extension scenario, role-based access is implemented for authenticated users and depending on the role assigned, users can create, update and delete data.

The basic steps showcased here are:

  1. Create a new mobile app definition in SAP Mobile Services and connect it to the BTP destination of an existing data service
  2. Access your Cloud Foundry environment
  3. Open Windsurf and ...
    1. Activate MCP server for mobile development kit
    2. Configure Rules for the agent
    3. Ensure the MDK Editor extension for VS Code is installed
    4. Use the Mobile App Editor offered by the extension to retrieve relevant information from SAP Mobile Services
  4. Start the agentic coding journey.

Creating the mobile app in SAP Mobile Services

Assuming you have an instance of SAP Mobile Services available in your SAP BTP subaccount, open the Mobile Services Admin cockpit.  You can do this via Service Marketplace, select Mobile Services and open the Support link. There is no need to create an instance here.

In the Mobile Services Admin cockpit, navigate to the Mobile Applications > Native/MDK tab and click New. Select Mobile Development Kit (MDK) as the type of application. Click Next.

Provide details about the app.

Click Next and leave the remaining configuration steps unchanged. Select Finish after reviewing the selected options.

Once the app definition is created, select Connectivity and select + to create a new mobile destination. This destination will act as a bridge between the mobile app and the data service.

In this case, I will use the destination type SAP Destination Service, as I am going to use the BTP destination that was created during the deployment of my CAP service to BTP. In the dropdown list for Cloud Destination Name, Iâ€™ve picked the name of the BTP destination.

Navigating back to the mobile app entry in SAP Mobile Services, we now select Security. We edit the application settings and make sure to Enable Cross Context SSO. This feature in SAP Mobile Services allows users to reuse their OAuth tokens obtained in one context (like a desktop browser or mobile browser) in another context (like a native mobile app). This eliminates the need for users to log in again when switching between platforms. It allows for seamless user authentication across multiple backend systems. In our case, we have a CAP-based service deployed to BTP that requires authentication, that makes use of an external data source coming from an S/4HANA Cloud system.

We are now done configuring the mobile app in SAP Mobile Services.

Access your Cloud Foundry environment

To be able to exchange information between your (local) development environment and your SAP Mobile Services instance, you need to log in to your BTP environment on Cloud Foundry. Make sure you have installed the Cloud Foundry CLI.

The easiest way to log in is by using the following command and follow the instructions to open the provided URL:

cf  login <your target endpoint> --sso

Your target endpoint is visible on the Overview page of your BTP subaccount as â€œAPI Endpointâ€.

Setting up Windsurf

We'll now open the Windsurf IDE. Before getting started with agentic coding, we need to configure a few things.

Add MCP server

Open the Windsurf Settings and select open MCP Marketplace. Add and enable the MCP server for mobile development kit. More details on how to do this can be found in the Setup guide.

Define Global Rules

To provide some guidance for the agent, define the following Global Rules. You can refine these rules as needed.

## Guidelines for MDK

Donâ€™t generate .service.metadata file

Donâ€™t generate .xml file in â€˜Servicesâ€™ folder

Donâ€™t change .project.json file

Installing the MDK Extension

As Windsurf does not offer a direct way to download and install extensions from Microsoft's Visual Studio Marketplace, we will need to manually download and install the MDK Extension (VSIX). There are a few options. The easiest one is opening VS Code, search for "mdk" in the Extensions: Marketplace pane and select the "mobile development kit extension for Visual Studio Code". Click the gear icon and select Download VSIX from the dropdown menu.

Drop the downloaded VSIX file into the Windsurf workspace, right click the file and select "Install Extension VSIX".

If you have already installed the extension in VS Code, then Windsurf is able to import the extensions directly.

Note: the drawback is that you have to check and perform updates manually. We are considering publishing our extensions on Open VSX as well.

Retrieve the mobile application details from SAP Mobile Services

For this project, we need to collect information about the mobile app definition and mobile destination we've created earlier. This information will be used by our tools when generating project artifacts. In Windsurf, go to the Command Palette and open â€œMDK: Open Mobile Application Editorâ€.

The Mobile Application Editor opens. We then select the application weâ€™ve created in SAP Mobile Services and tick the box of the destination.

By clicking â€œAdd App to Projectâ€, we collect all relevant information into a file named â€œ.service.metadataâ€. This information will be used to create the mobile application project in the next steps.

In case you are presented with the following popup, youâ€™ve missed the Security configuration in SAP Mobile Services to Enable Cross Context SSO.

Start agentic coding

We can now start coding, or should I say ... prompting. In Windsurf we open Cascade and prompt:

Create a mobile app allowing users to create, update and delete Products.

After some thinking and checking various tools offered through the MCP server for mobile development kit, the agent creates an app based on the CRUD template, makes several adjustments, triggers a build,  resolves linting issues, validates and deploys the app and finally shows the QR code for onboarding. I did not expect a 'one-shot prompt' to get this far!

Curious to see the result, we scan the QR code on the mobile phone and check the result.

The result is pretty standard output as you would get from a template. The list view shows mainly ID numbers, and they are even duplicated. The detail page contains a huge amount of information that is not easily consumed on a mobile device.

Let's make some adjustments. Prompts:

On the main page, change the title to "Products and Suppliers", replace the text "ProductsAndSuppliers" to "Windsurf showcase" and change the "Products" to "Show Products list".
On the list page, change the supplier id to supplier name

Figuring out the correct way to get to the supplier name took a few iterations of coding, build and deploy.

Eventually, the result is as follows:

The list view is more useful now. However, the selection of the supplier on the detail page is also just a list of IDs. It would be better to select based on supplier names.

Prompts:

On the detail page, change the supplier id to supplier name and show less details so the information can be easily consumed on a mobile device.
Attached are screenshots of the app while navigation the pages. Make them look more professional. Consult the documentation to confirm what is possible with MDK.

 And finally, I've asked to

Add a footer bar at the bottom of the screen with the text "Powered by Mobile Development Kit.

The last prompt took several iterations to get the right result. We probably need to enhance the information/knowledge we've collected in the MCP server to optimize this.

The end result:


Conclusion

Developing a mobile app based on Mobile Development Kit has become a lot easier with coding agents that can tap into an MCP server to use tools, retrieve the latest information and best practices.

The process of developing the app was similar to what we've experienced in Cursor. As a developer, you'll have to adjust prompts and steer the agent to get the results you want. Do not expect a complete and perfect result from one single prompt.

Although we provide various tools and editors in the MDK extension, the chat (in Windsurf called Cascade) tends to become the main interface for developing the app. The tools and editors are still useful for checking the results and making minor corrections.

As always, feedback is welcome.

I am also curious the know your experiences with coding agents such as WIndsurf, in combination with our MCP server for mobile development kit.

entry.title: Conversion of the payload to NDJSON
entry.content:
Hello all,

I am wondering if anyone was dealing with a conversion to New Delimited JSON in the iFlow, it is pretty new, and I haven't found any standard tool in the CPI yet /still working on NEO environment/.

Can anyone advise how to convert this? 

{
 "UsersPayload": {
                                  "User": [
                                                 {
                                                    "userId": "XXXXX",
                                                    "manager": "YYYYY"
                                                 },
                                                {
                                                   "userId": "ZZZZZ",
                                                   "manager": "YYYYY"
                                                }
                                                ]
                                }
}
This shall be the JAVA statement that does the magic
const ndjson = jsonData.map(item => JSON.stringify(item)).join('\n');
The trick is to try to convert that to Groovy.
 
Thank you,
Best Regards,
Dagmar

entry.title: Re: Marketplace App Security in SAP: What Every Developer...
entry.content: Ensuring strong security in SAP marketplace apps begins with proper identity, tenant isolation, and data protection strategies. Common pitfalls include weak authentication, insecure APIs, and overlooked GDPR requirements. Developers should rely on SAPâ€™s native security services such as XSUAA, OAuth, and IAS for access control, while using MTX services to maintain strict tenant boundaries in multi-tenant apps. Regular vulnerability scanning, encrypted communication, and audit logging are crucial for compliance and SAP Store certification. Early alignment with SAPâ€™s Secure Development Lifecycle (SDL) and documentation standards helps avoid delays. Security must be continuous â€” from development to deployment and beyond.

entry.title: Re: Copy data from last week of last month to first week...
entry.content:
Hi @saikhancs35 ,

you can try craeting a user defined property in your date dimension to mark the lastweek of the month as 'Y and read the same in data action to copy the data to next week(which is the first week on the next month).

IF [d/Weekly].[p/lastweekofmonth] = "Y" THEN
DATA([d/Measures]="QUANTITY_WEEKLY",[d/Weekly] = NEXT(1,"WEEK",[d/Weekly])) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures]= "QUANTITY_MONTHLY")
ENDIF

 Date Dimension Screesnhot with lastweekofmonth. You need to change the member management to user Managed to add a new property.

Regards,

Shivam

entry.title: Re: Required Scope Items for ISO 20022 Payment File Outpu...
entry.content:
Good day @byd 

Thank you for your question.

Here are some recommended references for more details.

Available Interfaces for Your Selected Scope, Integration Scenarios, Advanced Payment Management

Available Payment Medium Formats, Configuring Payment Medium Formats

To summarise, in the public cloud edition for Japan, you can generate ISO 20022 (PAIN.001) payment files without activating SAP Multi-Bank Connectivity. However, there are mandatory actions required:

  • First is to activate Bank integration file through File Interface (1EG)
  • Then configure payment medium format (e.g., /JP_ZENGINKYO or JP_PAIN_001)

It is not mandatory (but optional) to activate 4MT, J77, J78 & 16R.

This setup adheres to the clean-core approach and lets you output a fully compliant ISO 20022 file and manually upload it to your bankâ€™s web banking system

Similar question: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/1eg-bank-integration-with-file-interface/qaq-p/12817000

https://community.sap.com/t5/financial-management-q-a/intercompany-payment-runs-through-an-international-account/qaq-p/13763191

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris
